ai.summary: H100 – Shadforth is a 9.8 km moderate circular hike in the UK, offering a mix of countryside paths, meadows, and gentle woodland. The route suits hikers with average fitness and features rolling terrain with occasional stiles and gates, providing pleasant views and a relaxed day on the trail.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain includes well-defined footpaths, field edges and gentle woodland. Expect uneven ground and some mud after rain, plus stiles and occasional gates. Elevation changes are gentle but steady, making it suitable for a relaxed day out with standard hiking gear.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather before you go; UK conditions can change quickly. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and layered clothing, and bring a waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, be prepared for stiles and gates, and know your route. Start with daylight; plan for shorter days in autumn and winter and carry a headlamp if finishing after dark. Carry water and snacks, respect livestock, and keep gates as you found them. Inform someone of your plans and estimated return time. Be mindful of other hikers, cyclists, and dogs; keep dogs on lead where required.
recommended_gear: Backpack with enough capacity for layers and water
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) offer milder weather and longer daylight, with summer providing extended days. Winter hikes are possible but can be muddy and daylight is limited.
